post.body: Glad you liked the show. Here's more info about Naturally 7 (with related links in the left column): http://snurl.com/70af6
Chef Jeff's interview is now online: http://snurl.com/5dsgg
it's on its way! In the meantime you can listen to Chef Jeff's interview: http://snurl.com/5dsgg
Thank you! If you have any questions for the next one feel free to send them in. http://snurl.com/228an
Thanks for airing some of Odetta's interview and performance. The tribute looked great.
You can watch the Arianna Huffington and Annie Leibovitz interviews online: http://is.gd/b5KX
There was a schedule change for tonight. Hope you won't be too disappointed!
Absolutely! Glad to hear you find it useful that we put video of the show online.
Depends on which PBS station you watch. You can find local showtimes for your area here: http://is.gd/1Z8w
If you miss a show you can always watch it online. http://www.pbs.org/tavis/
Thanks for the suggestion! Have you seen our Young Voices blog? http://is.gd/eiPM
Thanks!
what station do you watch? Or what city are you in?
Tonight: Tribute to legendary singer Odetta who passed away yesterday. Includes her interview and performance from earlier this year.
Christopher Brown asks, "Why do you say 'Keep the faith' every night at the end of your show?" Find out: http://is.gd/24nG
Tonight: Legendary musician-composer-producer Quincy Jones. Watch preview: http://snurl.com/71j3r
Tonight: Alaska senator-elect Mark Begich discusses the need for a long-term energy plan and shares his thoughts on drilling in his state.
Have you seen our iPhone-optimized site? http://snurl.com/70hfa
Tonight: Alaska's Senator-elect Mark Begich and singer Tom Jones. http://snurl.com/70aiv
Tonight: Celebrating the 1,000th episode with a look back at some memorable moments from past shows. http://tinyurl.com/6s2uhk
Tonight: Natalie Cole reveals that her sister is putting out an album which combines her father's voice with artists like Nas & will.i.am.
Tonight: Rare conversation with singer-songwriter Yusuf -- better known to music fans as Cat Stevens. http://snurl.com/63yqg
Tonight: Pulitzer and Nobel Prize-winning author Toni Morrison discusses her new novel, "A Mercy." http://snurl.com/5zdn1
Tonight: Media mogul and philanthropist Ted Turner on his new memoir, "Call Me Ted." http://snurl.com/5tc4b
Tonight: NBA hall-of-famer and entrepreneur Earvin "Magic" Johnson. http://snurl.com/5qbwp
Appearing on NBC’s "Meet the Press" this Sunday (11/16/08). Check local listings. http://tinyurl.com/a5g29
Tonight: Chicago Sun-Times' religion columnist Cathleen Falsani. Singer-songwriter Sarah McLachlan performs. http://tinyurl.com/6dnxer
New video blog reflecting on the election: http://is.gd/24nG
Tonight: California Rep. Barbara Lee and actress CCH Pounder. Watch video preview: http://is.gd/7p7P
Tonight: The New Yorker's Jeffrey Toobin and Ben Ratliff, jazz critic for The New York Times.http://snurl.com/5dlvk
Tonight: Writer for The New Yorker Malcolm Gladwell. Also Rwandan genocide survivor Immaculee Ilibagiza. http://snurl.com/75x8p
In her last television appearance, Odetta performs the song "Keep on Moving it On." http://snurl.com/73lbt
Tonight: Musician Seal explains why he didn't feel left out of the recent election even though he's not a U.S. citizen. He also performs.
"Somebody’s head should arrive on a platter." -- Dan Neil, LA Times auto columnist on tonight's show
Tonight: Pulitzer Prize-winning LA Times automotive columnist Dan Neil and Judge Greg Mathis, author of Street Judge. http://snurl.com/7o7ec
Tonight:Jim Warren on the scandal around the IL Gov.Also Niall Ferguson discusses solutions for the global economic crisis.http://is.gd/b5az
Young Voices blog: Happy Anniversary Human Rights http://snurl.com/26ppq
Also tonight: Photographer Annie Leibovitz explains what it was like photographing Barack Obama on the campaign trail.http://snurl.com/7prwg
Tonight: Arianna Huffington discusses where she thinks the blogosphere is headed. Watch preview: http://snurl.com/7prwg
Tonight: Olympic gold medalist Michael Phelps. Funny preview video: http://snurl.com/7soes
Michael Phelps gets a surprise visit from Dustin Hoffman: http://snurl.com/7sa86
Tonight: Al Jarreau performs a track from his new holiday CD. Also actress Taraji P. Henson. http://is.gd/cAYE
Tonight: Musician will.i.am and author John Corcoran. Web exclusive video of will.i.am: http://snurl.com/8uri2
Behind-the-scenes video from last week's visit to the "Basic Black" set at WGBH: http://snurl.com/228an
Also tonight: Legendary comedian and actor Dick Van Dyke on how he became the narrator of The Wonder Kids documentary. http://is.gd/ccIu
Tonight: Ken Duberstein, chief of staff in the Reagan White House, weighs in on an auto industry bailout and the presidential transition.
Tonight: Sen. Tom Coburn says U.S. needs to shift its healthcare paradigm to one of prevention. Also actress Mia Kirshner. http://is.gd/c2kb
Also tonight: Jonathan Demme, producer-director of Rachel Getting Married, on the impact his '93 hit, Philadelphia, had on AIDS awareness.
Tonight: The Washington Post's Chris Cillizza weighs in on the scandal around Illinois Gov. Blagojevich. http://snurl.com/8bpn2
Happy New Year everyone! See you in 2009.
Tonight: Toni Morrison on the historical significance of the presidential election and her new novel, "A Mercy." http://is.gd/eiQ1
Tonight: Media mogul & philanthropist Ted Turner explains how he managed to keep his strong opinions out of CNN's coverage.http://is.gd/eeoY
Tonight: NBA hall-of-famer & entrepreneur Earvin "Magic" Johnson shares the advice he received that has made him a successful businessman.
Tonight: Columnist and author Thomas Friedman talks about the potential for unifying America around environmental issues. http://is.gd/dd8C
Tonight: Seal explains why he didn't feel left out of the recent election even though he's not a U.S. citizen. He also performs.
